channel.title: Documentation on Pionia
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Pionia

item.title: Introduction
item.description: About Welcome to the official documentation of pionia - /ˌpʌɪəˈnɪə/ framework.

item.title: Why Pionia?
item.description: Pionia was developed to make it easy for developers to build high-performance REST applications removing the unnecessary complexities that come with most common traditional frameworks.

item.title: Application Structure
item.description: Taking our directory structure from the API Tutorial we created here.

item.title: Frontend Integration
item.description: Pionia is a REST framework that is entirely meant for the backend.

item.title: API Tutorial
item.description: This section assumes that you have already setup your Pionia framework project.

item.title: Requests and Responses
item.description: All actions take up request data as associated array, and return a BaseResponse object. This guide will show you how to handle requests and responses in pionia.

item.title: Logging in Pionia
item.description: As a developer, you need to log information about the application’s state, errors, and other important information. This guide will show you how to log in pionia.

item.title: Commands( Pionia CLI)
item.description: Avails the availble commands in our Pionia CLI and how you can your custom commands.

item.title: Caching in Pionia
item.description: Pionia requests are all POST however, POST requests are not cached yet some may be getting data, this guides shows us how to cache requests.

item.title: Pionia Helpers
item.description: Helpers assist in quickly accessing parts of our application without implicitly creating instances.
